page.title: 09ECOLOGY,FLORA AND FAUNA
page.content: The flora and fauna in the rest of the block does not differ greatly from that found on the ranges,only changing when the soil structure becomes different,e.g. greensand.The recent absence of barn owls is probably linked with decline in the number of shrews and voles.House sparrows also disappeared when the human inhabitants of Imber were moved out at the start of the 1939 war.Among other birds spotted are whinchats,kestrels, stonechats,sparrowhawks,larks,plovers and buzzards.Hawthorn grows widely on uncultivated downland when birds drop seed,but due to the shallow soil it does not live very long.The ranges are generally colder at most times of the year but otherwise the climate is no different from the rest of the area.
